title: Work Experience
text:
Tutoring



Upcoming



Computational Sociology, September 2025 -



This course provides student with an introduction to the technical and statistical dimensions of different computational methods, hands-on examples of their use, and a venue of seminar discussion of applied examples.







Completed



Simulating Language, January 2025 - May 2025



During this course, we designed and conducted experiments using simple models to explore various questions, ranging from how we learn word meanings to the evolution of the language faculty.



Online Experiments for Language Scientists, September 2024 - December 2024



During course labs, we assisted undergraduate and postgraduate students in building online experiments using jsPsych (JavaScript).



Introduction to Cognitive Science, September 2024 – December 2024



During course labs, we gradually guided undergraduate students in learning how to use programming, specifically python, to solve research problems in cognitive science.



Data Analysis for Psychology Using R 2, September 2022 - May 2023



During course labs, we assisted undergraduate students with data analysis exercises and projects.






Co-supervision



Co-supervising a Master’s dissertation project in the MSc Evolution of Language and Cognition program with Professor Kenny Smith, from March 2024 to August 2024



This project explores bilingual reference production under cognitive load





Side Project



Learning and Teaching Mandarin in Scotland, November 2022 - December 2023



This project is led by Professor Antonella Sorace and funded by Confucius Institute for Scotland’s Schools (CISS) and Scotland’s National Centre for Languages (SCILT). Along with the other two research assistants, I engaged in designing questions for questionnaires and interviews, contacting schools, conducting interviews with pupils and teachers, performing quantitative and qualitative analysis as well as preparing a report.

title: Yajun Liu
text: Hi, I am a final-year (4th) PhD student in Linguistics at the School of Philosophy, Psychology and Language Sciences (PPLS), the University of Edinburgh. I am supervised by Professor Kenny Smith and Professor Antonella Sorace. I am also a member of the Centre for Language Evolution. My research project focuses on how native speakers with varying language experiences detect and resolve referential ambiguity. I explore the underlying mechanisms of their linguistic choices from both linguistic and cognitive perspectives. More broadly, I am interested in the role of communication in shaping languages over time.
